fr.ufc.l3info.oprog

Class ATM

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.ufc.l3info.oprog.ATM

  • public class ATM
extends java.lang.Object
    Class describing the automated teller machine.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ATM.NullCardException
      Nested class for null values used when inserting card.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ATM()
      Class constructor, initializes the ATM with a given amount of money.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ATM

        public ATM()
        Class constructor, initializes the ATM with a given amount of money. Starts the ATM in the idle state.

    • Method Detail

      • insertCard

        public int insertCard(Card c)
               throws ATM.NullCardException
        Insert card and checks that the card is valid. Only applicable when the ATM is in the idle state. Upon correct execution, expects the user to input his pin code.
        Parameters:
        c - the card inserted in the ATM
        Returns:
        0 if the inserted card is valid. -1 if a card is already in the ATM, -2 if the card is blocked, it is then ejected.
        Throws:
        ATM.NullCardException

      • inputPin

        public int inputPin(int p)
        Tries to identify the card holder by checking his pin. If he authenticates with success, expects then the user to choose the amount he wants to withdraw.
        Parameters:
        p - the pin code to check
        Returns:
        0 if the card holder is authenticated, -1 if the ATM is in the wrong state, -2 if the authentication failed, -3 if the card was blocked and is now ejected.

      • chooseAmount

        public int chooseAmount(int a)
        Selects the amount to withdraw. If the amount is correct, the ATM ejects the card.
        Parameters:
        a - the amount to withdraw. Possible values are 0 (cancel), 20, 30, 40, 50, 80, 100.
        Returns:
        0 if the selected amount is valid, -1 if the ATM is not in the appropriate state, -2 if the amount is not in the list of the possible values, -3 if the amount is more than the balance of card's account.

      • takeCard

        public Card takeCard()
        Takes back the card when it has been ejected. If a transaction was initiated, the bills are then ejected. Otherwise the ATM goes back to the idle state.
        Returns:
        the card that was ejected. null if the ATM was in the wrong state.

      • takeBills

        public int[] takeBills()
        The user takes the bills from the ATM. Upon successful execution, the ATM goes back to the idle state.
        Returns:
        An array of bill amounts. null if the ATM is in the wrong state
